alert.note: Alert for Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 3:12PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washita County through 345 PM CDT... At 312 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cordell, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cordell, Corn, and Cloud Chief. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
